page.title: 06A child's view of Trecastle
page.content: Trecastle is a small country village twelve miles away from Brecon and three miles away from Sennybridge.It is surrounded by lots of fields with sheep in them.There are two estates in Trecastle one is called Maes Y Berllan and the other is called Brynawellon. There is a main road running through the village it is very busy in the summer.There are two shops in the village one is a post office and a food shop the other is an antique shop that is just opening up. By Abigail Mosley (Aged 10)
